Uses of Interface
de.systemagmbh.tools.math.ISysRealFunction

Packages that use ISysRealFunction
de.systemagmbh.tools.math The Systema tools math package provides classes for mathematical and statistical issues.  
 

Uses of ISysRealFunction in de.systemagmbh.tools.math
 

Classes in de.systemagmbh.tools.math that implement ISysRealFunction
 class CSysChiSquareDistribution
          CSysChiSquareDistribution is defined as the probability that the observed chi-square for a correct model should be less than a value.
 class CSysExponentialRandom
          Generates exponential distributed values.
 class CSysRangeArgumentFunction
          Calculation of the w distribution requires evaluating an infinit integral.
 class CSysWDistributionFunction
          The w-Distribution is important when calculating the expected values of the range of sample of normally distributed arguments.
 

Methods in de.systemagmbh.tools.math with parameters of type ISysRealFunction
static double CSysMathTool.deviation(ISysRealFunction f, double argument)
          Calculates the first deviation of a Function at the point argument.
static double CSysMathTool.findValue(ISysRealFunction f, double result, double start, double precision)
          Calculates the argument of a Function with Newton's algorithm Iteration starts at the point start.
static double CSysMathTool.findMax(ISysRealFunction f, CSysInterval interval, double precision)
          Narrow a given interval towards the maximum of a function.
static double CSysMathTool.findMin(ISysRealFunction f, CSysInterval interval, double precision)
          Narrow a given interval towards the minimum of a function.
static double CSysMathTool.findIntervalValue(ISysRealFunction f, double result, CSysInterval interval, double precision)
          Find argument value of a function by narrowing a given interval.
static double CSysMathTool.rombergIntegral(CSysInterval integrationInterval, double tol, ISysRealFunction fx)
          Romberg - Integration of the RealFunction fx(x) in a given Interval and given maximum error.
